sections.heading: OSI Model Complete Guide
sections.text:
7 Layers of OSI Model (Detailed):

1. Physical Layer (Layer 1)
   • Electrical signals, cables, hubs
   • Bit transmission over physical medium
   • Examples: Ethernet cables, fiber optic

2. Data Link Layer (Layer 2)
   • MAC addresses, frame formatting
   • Error detection, flow control
   • Examples: Switches, bridges

3. Network Layer (Layer 3)
   • IP addressing, routing
   • Path determination
   • Examples: Routers, IP protocol

4. Transport Layer (Layer 4)
   • TCP/UDP protocols
   • Port numbers, reliability
   • Examples: TCP, UDP

5. Session Layer (Layer 5)
   • Session establishment, management
   • Dialog control
   • Examples: NetBIOS, RPC

6. Presentation Layer (Layer 6)
   • Data encryption, compression
   • Format conversion
   • Examples: SSL/TLS, JPEG

7. Application Layer (Layer 7)
   • User interface, network services
   • End-user applications
   • Examples: HTTP, FTP, SMTP

sections.heading: TCP vs UDP Detailed Comparison
sections.text:
TCP (Transmission Control Protocol):

• Connection-oriented protocol
• Reliable data delivery
• Error checking aur correction
• Flow control mechanism
• Sequence numbering
• Acknowledgment system
• Slower but reliable
• Used for: HTTP, HTTPS, FTP, SMTP

UDP (User Datagram Protocol):

• Connectionless protocol
• Unreliable delivery (best effort)
• No error correction
• No flow control
• Faster transmission
• Lower overhead
• Used for: DNS, DHCP, streaming

sections.heading: IP Addressing Fundamentals
sections.text:
IPv4 Address Structure:

• 32-bit address (4 octets)
• Dotted decimal notation
• Example: 192.168.1.1
• Network + Host portions

IPv6 Address Structure:

• 128-bit address
• Hexadecimal notation
• Example: 2001:0db8:85a3::8a2e:0370:7334
• Solves IPv4 exhaustion

Special IP Ranges:

• 127.0.0.1 - Loopback
• 0.0.0.0 - Default route
• 255.255.255.255 - Broadcast
• 169.254.x.x - APIPA
• 224.0.0.0-239.255.255.255 - Multicast

sections.heading: Domain Name System (DNS)
sections.text:
DNS Hierarchy:

1. Root Domain (.)
2. Top-Level Domain (.com, .org, .pk)
3. Second-Level Domain (google, facebook)
4. Subdomain (www, mail, ftp)

DNS Record Types:

• A Record - IPv4 address
• AAAA Record - IPv6 address
• CNAME - Canonical name
• MX - Mail exchange
• NS - Name server
• PTR - Reverse lookup
• TXT - Text information
• SOA - Start of authority

DNS Resolution Process:
1. Browser cache check
2. OS cache check
3. Router cache check
4. ISP DNS server
5. Root name servers
6. TLD name servers
7. Authoritative name servers

sections.heading: HTTP/HTTPS Protocols
sections.text:
HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol):

• Port 80 (default)
• Stateless protocol
• Request-response model
• Plain text communication

HTTP Methods:
• GET - Retrieve data
• POST - Submit data
• PUT - Update resource
• DELETE - Remove resource
• HEAD - Headers only
• OPTIONS - Available methods

HTTPS (HTTP Secure):

• Port 443 (default)
• SSL/TLS encryption
• Certificate-based authentication
• Data integrity protection

HTTP Status Codes:
• 1xx - Informational
• 2xx - Success (200 OK)
• 3xx - Redirection (301, 302)
• 4xx - Client Error (404, 403)
• 5xx - Server Error (500, 502)

sections.heading: SSL/TLS Security
sections.text:
SSL/TLS Handshake Process:

1. Client Hello
   • Supported cipher suites
   • Random number
   • Session ID

2. Server Hello
   • Selected cipher suite
   • Server certificate
   • Server random number

3. Key Exchange
   • Pre-master secret
   • Master secret generation
   • Session keys derivation

4. Finished Messages
   • Handshake verification
   • Secure communication starts

TLS Versions:
• TLS 1.0 - Deprecated
• TLS 1.1 - Deprecated
• TLS 1.2 - Widely used
• TLS 1.3 - Latest, most secure

sections.heading: Common Network Protocols & Ports
sections.text:
Well-Known Ports (0-1023):

• 20/21 - FTP (File Transfer Protocol)
• 22 - SSH (Secure Shell)
• 23 - Telnet
• 25 - SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol)
• 53 - DNS (Domain Name System)
• 67/68 - DHCP (Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol)
• 80 - HTTP (HyperText Transfer Protocol)
• 110 - POP3 (Post Office Protocol)
• 143 - IMAP (Internet Message Access Protocol)
• 443 - HTTPS (HTTP Secure)
• 993 - IMAPS (IMAP Secure)
• 995 - POP3S (POP3 Secure)

Registered Ports (1024-49151):

• 1433 - Microsoft SQL Server
• 1521 - Oracle Database
• 3306 - MySQL Database
• 3389 - RDP (Remote Desktop Protocol)
• 5432 - PostgreSQL Database
• 8080 - HTTP Alternate
• 8443 - HTTPS Alternate

sections.heading: Network Configuration & Analysis
sections.text:
Network Interface Types:

• Ethernet (eth0, ens33)
• Wireless (wlan0, wlp2s0)
• Loopback (lo)
• Virtual (tun0, tap0)

MAC Address Structure:
• 48-bit identifier
• 6 octets in hex
• First 3 octets - OUI (Organizationally Unique Identifier)
• Last 3 octets - Device identifier
• Example: 00:1B:44:11:3A:B7

sections.heading: Network Monitoring & Troubleshooting
sections.text:
Network Troubleshooting Steps:

1. Physical Layer Check
   • Cable connections
   • Link lights
   • Interface status

2. Data Link Layer Check
   • MAC address conflicts
   • Switch port status
   • VLAN configuration

3. Network Layer Check
   • IP configuration
   • Subnet mask
   • Default gateway

4. Transport Layer Check
   • Port accessibility
   • Firewall rules
   • Service status

5. Application Layer Check
   • Service configuration
   • DNS resolution
   • Application logs
